name: src/SICKComponentWrapper.js
SICKComponentWrapper
description: Wraps SICKComponent instances to provide high level API interfaces for non-React appliances.

name: constructor
description:
Initializes a React component and returns a wrapper which provides access to the DOM Element
and additional APIs for manipulating that DOM Element

params.name: node
params.description: The DOM Element to initialize (render) the component into.

params.name: properties
params.description: The properties to be applied to the component.

throws.description: Throws Error when `init()` is called on the component directly.

name: destroy
description: Tear down the React component and remove it from the DOM Element

name: update
description: Update the component with new properties. Will cause the affected node trees to be re-rendered React style.

name: src/SICKMuiTheme.js
content:
import {
  cyan500, cyan700,
  grey100, grey300, grey400, grey500,
  pinkA200, red900,
  white, darkBlack, fullBlack
} from 'material-ui/styles/colors'
import { fade } from 'material-ui/utils/colorManipulator'

const sickSecondaryColor = '#808080'

export default {
  spacing: {
    iconSize: 24,
    desktopGutter: 24,
    desktopGutterMore: 32,
    desktopGutterLess: 16,
    desktopGutterMini: 8,
    desktopKeylineIncrement: 64,
    desktopDropDownMenuItemHeight: 32,
    desktopDropDownMenuFontSize: 15,
    desktopDrawerMenuItemHeight: 48,
    desktopSubheaderHeight: 48,
    desktopToolbarHeight: 56
  },
  fontFamily: 'Source Sans Pro, sans-serif',
  palette: {
    primary1Color: cyan500,
    primary2Color: cyan700,
    primary3Color: grey400,
    accent1Color: pinkA200,
    accent2Color: grey100,
    accent3Color: grey500,
    textColor: darkBlack,
    iconColor: sickSecondaryColor,
    alternateTextColor: white,
    canvasColor: white,
    borderColor: grey300,
    disabledColor: fade(darkBlack, 0.3),
    pickerHeaderColor: cyan500,
    clockCircleColor: fade(darkBlack, 0.07),
    shadowColor: fullBlack
  },
  textField: {
    errorColor: red900
  }
}

name: src/SICKPlatform.js
connect
description:
Wraps react-redux's connect component to automatically provide our connected components
with our global store.

name: configure
description:
This function can be used to configure application level parameters
like websocket connection

name: registerTapEvents
description:
Called once on app start when tap events need to be registered by the platform

This is a constraint with the current React version. This may be deprecated in
future platform versions.

name: updateUserSettings
description: Update user settings by specifying a settings key and the settings to be updated.

params.name: settingsKey
params.description: The settings key to be updated. Typically a group ID.

params.name: settings
params.description:
New user settings to be merged into the current user
settings under the specified settings key.

src/components/GaugeWidget/Gauge.js
palette
description: material-ui/styles/colors

name: divStyle
description: style for #gauge-widget

types: {textAlign: string, marginTop: number, overflowY: string, height: number}

name: pageStyle
description: style for PaperComponent

types: {height: number, width: number, textAlign: string, display: string, paddingTop: number, marginTop: number}

name: svgStyle
description: style for svg element

name: gaugeStyle
description: style for svg using d3

types: {height: number, width: number, radius: number, innerRadius: number}

name: GaugeWidget
description:
This is GaugeWidget class.

Setup:-

Fetch basic configuration viz. minimum values, maximum values and rangeData(includes ranges with property like colors) from REST API for GaugeWidget.

Precondition:-

After successful response from REST API, initial requirement is to set required propTypes.

Prop 1: min, type: number, isRequired

Prop 2: max, type: number, isRequired

Prop 3: rangeData, type: array, isRequired

Integration:-

To integrate the widget one need to get widget config from REST API and set required propTypes. Post that one is ready to use the widget.

Description:-

The work of Gauge Widget is to show the reading between minimum & maximum values(includes min. & max.). The reading can lie within any range specified in config.

name: propTypes
description: Precondition (Static propTypes)

unknown.tagValue: { propTypes.min minimum value isRequired. ,  propTypes.max maximum value isRequired. , propTypes.rangeData Range of values isRequired.}

types: propTypes.min minimum value isRequired. ,  propTypes.max maximum value isRequired. , propTypes.rangeData Range of values isRequired.

name: constructor
description: creates a instance of GaugeWidget.

name: updateReading
description: loading initial reading for GaugeWidget.

name: showValue
description: showing current reading on mouseover

name: hideValue
description: hiding reading on mouseout

name: componentDidUpdate
description: updating buttonData

name: componentWillMount
description: setting interval and fetching reading for GaugeWidget.

name: componentDidMount
description: loading config information about GaugeWidget.

name: render
description: render

return.description: svg within PaperComponent to show GaugeWidget.

name: src/components/SICKComponent.js
SICKComponent
description: A base React component which is shared by all SICK platform React components

name: init
description: Initializes a component returning the DOM instance it was rendered into.

params.name: node
params.description: The {@link Element} to initialize (render) the component into.

params.name: properties
params.description: The properties to be applied to the component.

throws.description: Throws Error when `init()` is called on the component directly.

name: src/ducks/index.js
content:
import * as config from './config'
import * as userSettings from './userSettings'
import * as appbar from './appbar'
import * as gauge from './gauge'

export default {
  config,
  userSettings,
  appbar,
  gauge
}
